Messages.Author: Stella Unruh
Messages.Content: Dear students, the exams will be in the Z-building, either in the rooms Z104 (first floor) or Z214 (second floor). Please check the room for your exam date here:  https://isis.tu-berlin.de/mod/resource/view.php?id=1754441

Messages.Author: Stella Unruh
Messages.Content: Dear students,  the exams on the 9th and 10th of April will take place in room Z105 instead of Z104.

Messages.Author: Stella Unruh
Messages.Content: Dear students, you can find the course evaluation now under the following link: https://befragung.tu-berlin.de/evasys/online.php?p=QEW94  Thanks for participating, your feedback is highly appreciated. You will also have time to fill it out in the summary lecture next monday. In the summary lecture, we will quickly go through all of the topics we covered this semester, therefore it will be longer than our usual lectures.

Messages.Author: Stella Unruh
Messages.Content: Dear students, next week the mandatory homework assignment, the debating competition will take place. I would like to keep a 5 minute buffer between each debate, to give you some room for possible feedback and time to change to the next group without a rush. Therefore, we will have the discussions in two blocks, first one starting at 10 AM (not 10:15!) in our usual room H 3007, ending around 12:20. Second one will be in Z113, starting at 1 PM and ending around 15:20. You can check the block and the specific time slot for your group here: https://isis.tu-berlin.de/mod/resource/view.php?id=1744503  If there are any groups that are not able to hold the debate in the proposed time slot (due to an overlap with another lecture or exam), please let me know so I can adjust the schedule.  Please be on time, to not interrupt the discussions.

Messages.Author: Stella Unruh
Messages.Content: Dear students,  due to some overlaps, the schedule was updated. Please check your slot again and let me know if there is any more need to adjust times.

Messages.Author: Stella Unruh
Messages.Content: Dear students,  there was one last change in the schedule. We will now have 8 debates in the first block and 6 in the second to avoid overlaps with other lectures for all of you. This means, that the lunch break will be 20 minutes later than scheduled before.  See you all tomorrow and looking forward to your debates!

Messages.Author: Stella Unruh
Messages.Content: Short reminder for the groups in Block 2: We will be in Z113 (Z Building, First Floor), starting at 13:15.

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Reminder on exam registration and additional exam slots

Messages.Author: Stella Unruh
Messages.Content: Dear students, this is a short reminder, that the registration deadline in ISIS for the exam is on the 12th of February. If you want to take the exam this semester, please register. Furthermore, I added a few additional exam slots on the 26th of February, the 20th of March and 9th of April. Please pick your exam slot till the 12th of February.  Please remember, to only book one exam slot! This slot is then reserved for you and can not be changed.

Messages.Author: Stella Unruh
Messages.Content: Dear students, happy new year to all of you! Next Monday will be our guest lecture on the topic climate anxiety. There will be no online live stream of this lecture, as it will be more in the direction of an open discussion. So if you are interested in the topic and want to take part in the lecture and discussion, please come in person.

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Homework assignment: Merging of small groups

Messages.Author: Stella Unruh
Messages.Content: Dear students, as some groups for the homework assignment are left with only three group members, I would suggest to merge this groups so no one of you needs to work on his or her own.  For the groups with only three (or less) members left, please write me an E-Mail till the 22nd of December with the following information: - Group topic - Names of current group members - Your current working status ( Please be honest. I will try to merge the groups in a way that groups that have already worked a lot on the topic will keep their topic) If you are only three students left, but want to keep your group as it is (so one of you is working on the pro or con on his or her own), this is also fine, please still send me an E-Mail and let me know.  I wish you all a great holiday season and see you in January!

Messages.Author: Stella Unruh
Messages.Content: Dear students, the exam dates are now available in ISIS and registration for the exam slots will open tomorrow at 10 AM. You can book your exam slot till the 12th of February. Please remember, that the slot can not be changed after booking it, so make sure the time fits for you before reserving it. There are special slots reserved for the ones of you taking the Schwerpunkt exam, they are labelled with "Schwerpunkt" behind the date. If you want to take the Schwerpunktexam, please make sure you take one of these slots and please do not book one of them if you are taking the "normal" 6LP course!

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Exam registration and survey on preferred exam month

Messages.Author: Stella Unruh
Messages.Content: Dear students, Exam registration via MTS is open from today till mid of february. Please check todays lecture slides for details on the registration process. Concerning registration for a specific exam slot via ISIS, please fill out this survey on your preffered exam month till the end of the week. https://isis.tu-berlin.de/mod/choice/view.php?id=1720666 I will plan the distribution of the exam slots over the months based on this survey.

Messages.Author: Stella Unruh
Messages.Content: Dear students,  as the registration for the Schwerpunkt exam caused some questions: If you have already completed ALCA and have not yet registered for the exam, please register now, so you can take the exam at the end of the semester. If you will complete ALCA next semester, you can either register now or next semester, bot is possible. Please make sure, that you do not register twice.

Messages.Author: Stella Unruh
Messages.Content: Dear students, our guest lecture needs to be postponed to January. Therefore there is a change concerning the order of the lecture topics. You can find the updated schedule here: https://isis.tu-berlin.de/pluginfile.php/3066748/mod_resource/content/3/Overview%20semester.pdf

Messages.Author: Stella Unruh
Messages.Content: Dear students, as we only have six groups for seminar task 2, we decided to change the presentation style. There will be no poster session with handwritten posters, instead please use the PowerPoint templates to create a digital poster.  https://isis.tu-berlin.de/mod/folder/view.php?id=1629934  We will then use the projector and you will present in front of the whole class, similar to task 1.

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Open HiWi position at SEE department

Messages.Author: Stella Unruh
Messages.Content: Dear students, our department has an open HiWi position, you can find the job advertisement here: https://isis.tu-berlin.de/mod/resource/view.php?id=1719597

Messages.Author: Stella Unruh
Messages.Content: Dear students, the poll for the homework assignment is now available on ISIS.  https://isis.tu-berlin.de/mod/ratingallocate/view.php?id=1714475  Please fill in your top 3 priorities until the 10th of November.

Messages.Author: Stella Unruh
Messages.Content: Dear students,  please remember that the deadline for the homework assignment poll is today at 23:59. Participating in the debate is mandatory to register for the exam.

Messages.Author: Stella Unruh
Messages.Content: Dear students, if you missed to fill out the poll and still want to take the course, please send me an e-mail until tomorrow 12 PM. I will then allocate you to an available topic. Please remember that taking part in the homework assignment is a necessary requirement to register for the exam!

Messages.Author: Stella Unruh
Messages.Content: Dear students,  you can now find the homework assignment groups in the ISIS course: https://isis.tu-berlin.de/mod/resource/view.php?id=1719047 I allocated you according to your priorities. There is one group with five members, all the others of you are four. If you can't find yourself in the list but signed up for the assignment, please send me an e-mail. Please contact your group members to start working on the assignment.

Messages.Author: Stella Unruh
Messages.Content: Dear students,  in case some of you were here early this morning before I was able to take down the note on the classroom door: the lecture and seminar will take place today. Sorry if this caused any misunderstanding.

Messages.Author: Stella Unruh
Messages.Content: Dear students, due to illness, the lecture and seminar will not take place today. Please let your fellow students know who might not see this in time. I will upload the updated schedule for this semester the next days. Sorry for the late notice and see you next week!

Messages.Author: Stella Unruh
Messages.Content: Dear all, the lecture and seminar will take place from 10:15-11:45 & 12:15-13:45 as decided in the voting.  See you tomorrow!

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Vote on lecture time and slides

Messages.Author: Stella Unruh
Messages.Content: Dear students, you can find the lecture slides of today and the vote on the lecture time in the ISIS section for today. Please vote till friday evening. Best Stella

Messages.Author: Thilo Ralph Peter Schaufler

Messages.Author: Stella Unruh
Messages.Content: Dear Thilo,  I transferred the grades to the Prüfungsamt in mid April after the last exams. They should be visible in Qispos by now. If not, please let me know so I can contact them once again.  Best Stella

Messages.Author: Thilo Ralph Peter Schaufler
Messages.Content: Dear Stella, I just saw that everything was registered. I was just looking in the wrong place (Moses) and not in the TU portal. Thank you very much for clarifying.  I wish you a good week, Thilo

Messages.Author: Thilo Ralph Peter Schaufler
Messages.Content: Dear Mrs Unruh, I would like to ask if the contents covered during the seminars, especially the group debate, will be covered individually (each person for their task) in the  exam as well. I do believe you mentioned something regarding this issue in the beginning of the summary lecture, but unfortunately I joined a few minutes to late and din't hear all of it.  Thank you very much.

Messages.Author: Stella Unruh
Messages.Content: Dear Thilo,  The content of the seminars and the debate will not be part of the exam. Same for the guest lecture on climate neutrality, which is also not relevant for the exam.  Best Stella

Messages.Author: Elena Marina Huber
Messages.Content: There was a question in the zoom chat: "In the permanance part, I'd like to ask how the duration of carbon offsetting technology is calculated in the criteria. For example, plant biomass can capture more CO2 than pyrolyzed biochar, but decomposes faster so that releases CO2 easily. Do the criteria differentiate the stability of each technology?" Answer: The criteria themselves do not differentiate the stability of the technology but the standards set timeframes for how long the storage should last. These time frames depend on the specific technology and the standard. Generally, there is the agreement that each technology should store the carbon for at least 100 years (I added that on the slides), but this is not the case for every project.

Messages.Author: Stella Unruh
Messages.Content: Dear students,  as the question arise in the zoom lecture: if you want to take the Schwerpunktmodul and have not yet completed advanced LCA, please do not register for an exam slot on ISIS. The Schwerpunkt exam needs to be done as one exam, after you completed both courses. The registration for MTS can be done in both semesters, so you can already register for the Schwerpunkt there even if you will do the exam next semester.  For further questions on this topic, please reply here.

Messages.Author: Nicolas Frederik Thiel
Messages.Content: Hello Friends ! We (group 6) are searching for a new groupmate for seminar task 3, because one groupmate does not take part in this course anymore. So if there is still someone without a group, please write me (01575 642 8147). you can also leave a comment here of course :) Maybe there are other groups with the same problem and we can combine these groups? Would be nice to have at least 4 people, because every group should split up in teams of two if Im not mistaken ;)  Best regards Nico

Messages.Author: Thilo Ralph Peter Schaufler
Messages.Content: Will the positions (pro / contra) be randomly assigned on the day of the presentation or is it up to the groups to choose?  Thank you

Messages.Author: Stella Unruh
Messages.Content: You will decide yourself who will represent which side in the beginning of the group work. Afterwards you should continue to work on your arguments in your team of two. Of course you are free to choose continuing working all together, but for a debate it is useful if your opponent does not know all your arguments in advance. Please check the slides for further information, it is explained there: https://isis.tu-berlin.de/pluginfile.php/2916958/mod_resource/content/2/1%20Seminar.pdf

Messages.Author: Thilo Ralph Peter Schaufler
Messages.Content: Hey there, I just wanted to ask if the presentations will be shared with the course. There were a few things on some slides, which were quite interessting.  Thank you very much.

Messages.Author: Stella Unruh
Messages.Content: Dear Thilo,  good idea. I created a database, where you should be able to share your own presentation and download the ones of the others as soon as there uploaded. So dear all, please upload your group presentations. https://isis.tu-berlin.de/mod/data/view.php?id=1720415

Just comment or send me a message via Zoom, thank you a lot!  Kind regards Jannina

Messages.Content: Dear Josepha,  there is now an overview on the semester available. https://isis.tu-berlin.de/mod/resource/view.php?id=1713170

Messages.Author: Thomas Ludewig
Messages.Content: It looks like the third vote option is not correct. The duration would be until 14:00. https://isis.tu-berlin.de/mod/choice/view.php?id=1700317

Messages.Author: Stella Unruh
Messages.Content: Thats true, thanks for the note. I updated it.

Messages.Author: Daniela Cristina Fernandez Castillo
Messages.Content: Dear teacher, Is it possible to take this course online? Unfortunately, I have problems attending in person for the first few months.

Messages.Author: Stella Unruh
Messages.Content: Dear Daniela Castillo, attendance during lecture and seminar is not mandatory. Nevertheless, there will be a homework assignment (group work) that will be presented towards the end of the semester (February) which is mandatory. Forming of the groups will take place online in the ISIS course end of October/beginning of November. There will be no recordings of the lecture available, but all lecture slides will be uploaded in the ISIS course. Joining the course later is no problem in general, but please make sure to contact your homework group and manage the homework preparation while you’re not yet able to join in person.

Messages.Author: Eva Zhan
Messages.Content: Hello, at what time does the course start on Monday? Best regards, Eva

Messages.Author: Stella Unruh
Messages.Content: Dear Eva,  The course will start at 10:15.  Best Stella Unruh
